title: When Sound Equipment goes through a Combine Harvester

tasks.task: Observing and describing a barley field and comparing it to wheat fields.
subtasks: Noting the location of the field as in the prairies.
Identifying the type of crops (barley) and distinguishing it from wheat.
Comparing prairie agriculture to B.C. agriculture in terms of field layout and practices.
Recognizing the importance of machinery in prairie farming.

tasks.task: Touring machinery used in barley harvesting.
subtasks: Describing the function of a swather.
Explaining the process of a combine harvester.
Identifying and explaining the use of a dump truck in agriculture.
Describing the operation of an auger for moving grain.
Noting the size and scale of grain storage facilities on the farm.

tasks.task: Documenting challenges in filming agricultural machinery.
subtasks: Mentioning physical challenges like dropping a microphone.
Observing the fate of dropped equipment (e.g., being incorporated into the combine).

tasks.task: Discussing the role of mechanics in prairie farming.
subtasks: Highlighting the necessity of mechanical skills for farm operation.

tasks.task: Subtasks are generalized into key tasks related to the farming operations depicted. Physical tasks performed by the narrator (e.g., holding a microphone, dropping it) are included as part of the broader experience but not as major tasks. The task of operating the machinery is not included as the narrator is a tourist observing, not performing the tasks. The initial task of differentiating barley from wheat is derived from the explicit recognition in the transcript. The tour of the machinery is a significant part of the video, hence separate MAINTASK. Challenges with filming are also a notable part (though secondary) of the content.
